sugar makes children hyper we've all
heard this before and maybe you've even
observed it in kids but actually it's a
misconception there are lots of widely
believed misconceptions about signs that
are just plain wrong like you only use
10% of your brain you really use 100% of

you these are a few misconceptions about
sugar that I've noticed in the past few
months at least a dozen Studies have
looked at how children behave on diets
containing different levels of sugar
both natural sugars you find in fruit
and added sugars you find in chocolate
or candy and lollies none of these
studies found significant differences in
Behavior between kids who had sugar and
kids that didn't and in another study
parents who thought their kids had just
consumed a sugary drink rated their kids

that drink was really
sugarfree often it's kids surroundings
that influen them to be hyper they're
excited with friends or at a birthday
party and parents often attribute this
Behavior to
Sugar it is correct to say that Sugar
can cause tooth decay but technically it
doesn't directly rot your teeth in your
mouth you have five 500 to 1,000
different types of bacteria kind of
gross and a few species of these are
thought to cause cavities the main
culprit is streptococus mutans s mutans
loves to feed on the carbohydrates left
on your teeth as residue from sugars or
from starching BR potatoes from this s

your enamel begins to dissolve of course
the more sugar you eat the more residue

teeth you may have seen this well
structured tongue map before but there's
no one area for different taste
receptors on your tongue this myth is
thought to originate from one study in
1901 but it wasn't deep bunked until
1974 really your taste buds are all over
your tongue they live in your pil the
tiny bumps that give your tongue its
rough texture in your taste buds there's
different cells that respond to sweet
sour salty bitter or Umami tastes Umami
being the taste of glutamate that gives
meat and Delicacies like Vite their
Savory flavor your taste cells have 50
to 150 receptors for each taste when
they're stimulated they send messages to
the brain where those specific tastes
are perceived now the reason I know
